page.title: 14NEWHAVEN BUILDINGS FROM 1868
page.content: Fort Newhaven was built in 1868. Covering ten acres it has underground passages, gun emplacements, a dry moat and a central parade ground with perimeter casemates, each originally housing sixteen men. Used during both World Wars, two new tunnels were dug through to the beach in the Second World War, to prevent invasion. Neglected for years, the fort was restored and opened as a tourist attraction in 1983. Denton Island was created in the nineteenth century when the river was straightened. The modern swing bridge carrying the A259 over the Ouse was constructed in 1974. Modern buildings in Newhaven include the shopping precinct, swimming pool and police station. The latter is constructed round an internal courtyard, intended as a prisoners' exercise yard.
